page.title: 14TRANSPORT IN EDGEFIELD
page.content: Transport, or rather the lack of it, affects many aspects of village life. One can travel to Norwich by bus to fit in with a normal working day, but nobody from Edgefield can work in Holt Sheringham or Cromer without some form of private transport. This particularly affects the young as they cannot get jobs without a car, and cannot afford a car until they have a job. If they want entertainment in the evening, there is a bus to Cromer, but none to come home again. More seriously those relying on public transport can only reach the doctor on Tuesdays and Fridays. Young mothers must learn to drive. The elderly must rely on the kindness of their neighbours. Fortunately more private services are starting with the needs of local communities in mind. The bus from Aldborough goes through to Holt.
